page.title: 01Southern Isle of Luing
page.content: The island of Luing lies off the coast of Argyll and is about 9km N to S and 3KM E to W. It is low lying max height in this southern half is 85m. The ground is mainly rough moorland,with wetlands round the only loch, used as the islands water supply. Some areas have been draind and are used for growing animal feedstuff,to cater for the large number of cattle and sheep reared here. This is the home of the Luing breed of beef cattle. The main employment is in the farm of Ardlarch which has extended to cover almost the whole of Luing. The coast line is rocky with muddy bays and inlets. The coastal waters are fished for lobsters prawns, scallops and salmon.Apart from a small number at Black Mill Bay most people live in Toberorochy in the SE. A small number find self employment or travel to Oban (20 miles) for work.
